The new or amended policies must be aimed at addressing the ethical concerns raised and must be adopted by at least 50% of the member states of the World Health Organization. Influence on global health policies is defined as the adoption of new or revised policies, guidelines, or recommendations by at least three of the following organizations: World Health Organization (WHO), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), or similar national or international health bodies. The influence of microbiology advancements is measured by the direct citation of microbiological research or data in the formulation of these policies. Technological advancements include, but are not limited to, developments in medical devices, health information technologies, and biotechnology. The comparison between the influences of microbiology and technology will be assessed based on the number of policies influenced, the scope of the impact, and the depth of the changes implemented. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear evidence, the question will resolve as No.

The influence of microbiology advancements is measured by the direct citation of microbiological research or data in the formulation of these policies.

P.title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in the understanding of social physics that influences public policy by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant breakthrough in the field of social physics is announced and has influenced public policy. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that fundamentally changes the understanding or application of social physics in a way that directly impacts public policy formulation or implementation. The breakthrough must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference. The influence on public policy must be evidenced by the adoption of new policies, significant amendments to existing policies, or the initiation of public policy debates directly attributable to the breakthrough. The adoption or amendment of policies must be confirmed by official government documentation or statements from a recognized authority in the field. In the absence of direct government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The breakthrough must be recognized by the scientific community, as evidenced by citations in subsequent research or endorsements by recognized experts in the field.

P.title: Will Switzerland become a global leader in blockchain technology development by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Switzerland is recognized as a global leader in the development of blockchain technology. Recognition can come from:
- Being home to the highest number of successful blockchain startups, as reported by a reputable global market research firm.
- Leading in blockchain-related patents filed and granted, according to the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO).
- Hosting the most significant global blockchain technology conferences, as recognized by the international tech community.
- Receiving the highest level of investment in blockchain technology projects, as reported by major financial news outlets.

Recognition must be corroborated by reports from at least three reputable sources, including but not limited to the Financial Times, Bloomberg, or Forbes. In the event of conflicting reports, the majority consensus among these sources will be used to determine the outcome.

The development of blockchain technology refers to the innovation, research, and successful implementation of blockchain systems and solutions.

P.title: Will North Korea significantly reform its legal system by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, North Korea has implemented significant reforms in its legal system. Significant reforms are defined as changes that lead to increased transparency, the establishment of independent judiciary bodies, the introduction of laws that significantly enhance human rights protections, or the reduction of the government's direct control over legal proceedings. The reforms must be recognized and reported by at least three reputable international news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, Reuters) or international human rights organizations (Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch). In the absence of direct reports, official government announcements or documentation will be considered. The question will resolve as No if such reforms are not implemented or if they are reversed before the resolution date. In the case of ambiguous reforms, a consensus among the aforementioned sources will be required to determine the significance of the reforms.

P.title: Will Elon Musk's companies contribute to a significant breakthrough in nuclear fusion technology by 2030?

P.title: Will a major breakthrough in genetics lead to a significant increase in crop resilience to climate change by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major breakthrough in genetics leads to a significant increase in crop resilience to climate change. The increase in resilience must be demonstrated through peer-reviewed scientific research, recognized by the global scientific community, and must show practical application in at least three different major crops (e.g., rice, wheat, maize).

P.title: Will NASA's commercial partnerships significantly boost the space economy by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, NASA's commercial partnerships have led to a significant boost in the space economy, as evidenced by:

- A minimum of 50% increase in global space industry revenue compared to 2020, adjusted for inflation. This includes revenues from satellite launches, space tourism, space mining, and other commercial space activities.

- The establishment of at least one commercially viable off-Earth manufacturing facility or habitat, operational and generating revenue.

- The successful launch and operation of at least five significant new commercial space missions (e.g., satellite constellations, space tourism missions, asteroid mining operations) directly resulting from NASA's partnerships.

Significant boost will be determined based on reports from authoritative sources in the space industry, such as the Space Foundation, the International Astronautical Federation, or equivalent. In the absence of direct reports, credible coverage from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Economist) will be considered.

In case of ambiguity, the consensus of the scientific and commercial space community will be used to determine the outcome.

P.title: Will the United States become the world's largest producer of renewable energy by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United States is officially recognized as the world's largest producer of renewable energy, measured by total megawatts (MW) of renewable energy capacity installed or by total renewable energy generated in a year. Renewable energy includes solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass energy sources. The assessment will be based on data and reports from authoritative sources such as the International Energy Agency (IEA), the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA), or equivalent. In the event of discrepancies between sources, the source with the most comprehensive and recent data will be considered authoritative. The resolution will consider only operational capacity, excluding projects under construction or in planning stages. In case of a tie or near-tie (within a 1% margin), the question will resolve as No, requiring clear leadership in renewable energy production.

P.title: Will a significant discovery in space lead to a new economic model or job sector as predicted by the Bureau of Labor Statistics by 2030?

The discovery must lead to the creation of jobs that did not exist prior to the discovery, and these jobs must be recognized as part of a new sector or economic model. Temporary or speculative job creation does not meet this criterion. The question resolves as Yes only if the new economic model or job sector is operational and recognized by the end of 2030.

P.title: Will Germany become a global leader in renewable energy technology by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Germany is recognized as a global leader in renewable energy technology. P.title: Will there be a significant shift in environmental philosophy influencing global climate policy by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant shift in environmental philosophy that influences global climate policy. A "significant shift" is defined as the adoption of a new or substantially revised environmental philosophy that leads to the implementation of new global climate policies or the amendment of existing ones. This shift must be recognized and reported by at least three major international organizations involved in climate change (e.g., United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, World Meteorological Organization) or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The new or revised philosophy must lead to actionable policy changes at the international level, such as new global agreements, significant amendments to existing treaties, or the establishment of new global climate goals. The resolution will consider the consensus of the scientific community and authoritative sources on the matter. In the event of ambiguous or conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the preponderance of evidence from the specified sources.
